name: Windows PowerShell Cmdlet File
summary: A PS1 file is a script , or "cmdlet," used by Windows PowerShell, a Windows shell program built on Microsoft's .NET Framework. It contains a series of commands written in the PowerShell scripting language. PS1 files are similar to .BAT and .CMD files, except that they are executed in Windows PowerShell instead of the Windows CMD.EXE and COMMAND.COM programs.

content: Cmdlets can be used to automate Windows tasks. For example, a cmdlet may rename a group of files to use a new file extension. Another cmdlet may examine the Windows registry and output results to a file. Cmdlets also support aliases, pipelines , and named and positional parameters for commands.

On Windows, you can open and execute PS1 scripts in Windows PowerShell. However, you should be careful when executing PS1 scripts, as they might contain commands that access and alter critical Windows operating system components. Do not execute a PS1 script unless you can verify its legitimacy and source.
